definition: delaying tactics/deliberate procrastination
to drag/to tow/to trail/to hang down/to mop (the floor)/to delay/to drag on
variant of 拖[tuo1]
surname Yan
to prolong/to extend/to delay
to fight/fight/war/battle
various genera of flowers of Asteracea family (daisies and chrysanthemums), including Atractylis lancea
method/technique

sentences.english: This was just the latest in a series of delaying tactics.
sentences.chinese: 这只是一系列拖延战术中的一个新花招。

sentences.english: Ministers are using delaying tactics to postpone the report yet again.
sentences.chinese: 部长们再次使用拖延战术来推后报告的时间。

sentences.english: Whether the delaying tactics the Taliban and foreign troops have staying power?
sentences.chinese: 塔利班是否采取拖延战术和外国部队比持久力？

definition: delaying tactics/stalling/measures to stave off an attack/stratagem to win a respite
to procrastinate/to stall for time/to filibuster
a blitzkrieg strategy (idiom)/to resolve sth in the shortest time possible/to get sth done quickly
an emergency measure
defensive position/guard
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
to delay/to put off/to procrastinate
to gain the initiative by striking first (idiom); to preempt/to anticipate/preemptive
psychological warfare/psychological operations/psyop
to submit/to give in
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
unyielding attitude
to counter every move/to be full of tricks
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
lit. quick sword cuts through tangled hemp (idiom); decisive action in a complex situation/cutting the Gordian knot
lit. to pull a snake from its hole/to expose a malefactor (idiom)
